intro: Ptychoraphis longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered ptychoraphis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the warmer months. Ptychoraphis longiflora is often found in dry environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
